title: When do you italicize dialogue punctuation? - Quora

response.answer_text: When a passage of dialogue is set in italics, any punctuation belonging to the passage should be similarly italicized. In the following, italicize the commas separating the emphasized words as well as the exclamation mark belonging to the third “can’t”, but do not italicize the exclamation mark at the end: She said, “No, you can’t have another candy bar — you can’t, can’t, can’t! have another candy bar!”In the following, italicize the second comma because it’s part of the foreign phrase being used by the speaker, but do not italicize the final period, because it pertains to your quoting of the speaker, not to the italicized passage within her speech: When we arrived, the hostess insouciantly signaled the state of the cocktail party: “Howdy, y’all, and lasciate ogni speranza, voi ch’entrate.”
